014package org.jdbi.v3.postgres;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.math.BigDecimal;
018import java.time.Duration;
019import java.util.Optional;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapper;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapperFactory;
024import org.postgresql.util.PGInterval;
025
026/**
027 * A column mapper which maps Postgres's {@link PGInterval} type to Java's {@link Duration}.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * Not all {@link PGInterval}s are representable as {@link Duration}s. E.g., one with months, which is an
031 * <em>estimated</em> {@link java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit}, or one whose seconds is larger than a {@code long}. An
032 * {@link IllegalArgumentException} will be thrown in either case.
033 */
034public class DurationColumnMapperFactory implements ColumnMapperFactory {
035    @Override
036    public Optional<ColumnMapper<?>> build(Type type, ConfigRegistry config) {
037        if (type != Duration.class) {
038            return Optional.empty();
039        }
040        return Optional.of((r, i, c) -> {
041            final Object obj = r.getObject(i);
042            if (obj == null) {
043                return null;
044            }
045            if (!(obj instanceof PGInterval)) {
046                throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("got non-pginterval %s", obj));
047            }
048            final PGInterval interval = (PGInterval) obj;
049            if (interval.getYears() != 0 || interval.getMonths() != 0) {
050                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
051                        String.format("pginterval \"%s\" not representable as duration", interval.getValue()));
052            }
053            final double seconds = interval.getSeconds();
054            if (seconds > Long.MAX_VALUE || seconds < Long.MIN_VALUE) {
055                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
056                        String.format("pginterval \"%s\" has seconds too extreme to represent as duration",
057                                interval.getValue()));
058            }
059            final long secondsLong = (long) seconds;
060            final long nanos = BigDecimal.valueOf(seconds)
061                    .subtract(BigDecimal.valueOf(secondsLong))
062                    .movePointRight(9)
063                    .longValue();
064            return Duration.ofDays(interval.getDays())
065                    .plusHours(interval.getHours())
066                    .plusMinutes(interval.getMinutes())
067                    .plusSeconds(secondsLong)
068                    .plusNanos(nanos);
069        });
070    }
071}
